constraints.examples: Smart Bags, Location Trackers in Baggage
constraints.carry_on_details: Baggage equipped with lithium batteries must be carried as carry-on baggage unless the batteries are removed from the baggage. [cite_start]Removed batteries must be carried in accordance with the provision for Batteries, Lithium [cite: 12]
constraints.checked_details: Smart bags can be checked once the battery is removed. [cite_start]Baggage location tracking devices (or "bag tags") powered by lithium batteries are allowed in checked bags if devices do not exceed 0.3 grams (lithium metal) or 2.7 watt hours (Lithium). [cite: 12]

constraints.examples: Power Banks, cell phone battery charging cases, rechargeable and non-rechargeable lithium batteries, cell phone batteries, laptop batteries, power banks, external batteries, portable rechargers
constraints.carry_on_details: Lithium metal (non-rechargeable) batteries are limited to 2 grams of lithium per battery. Lithium ion (rechargeable) batteries are limited to a rating of 100 watt hours (Wh) per battery. [cite_start]With airline approval, passengers may also carry up to two spare larger lithium ion batteries (101-160 Wh) or Lithium metal batteries (2-8 grams). [cite: 12]
constraints.checked_details: [cite_start]Not allowed in Checked Bags [cite: 12]

constraints.examples: Battery-powered E-cigarettes (e-cigs), vaporizers, vape pens, atomizers, electronic nicotine delivery systems
constraints.carry_on_details: Electronic smoking devices when carried by passengers or crewmembers must be carried on one's person or in carry-on baggage. Electronic smoking devices are battery powered and have a heating element that vaporizes liquid. [cite_start]Passengers are required to take effective measures for preventing accidental activation of the heating element of the device when transporting the devices. [cite: 12]
constraints.checked_details: [cite_start]Not allowed in Checked Bags [cite: 12]

rules.item_name: Items not Otherwise Listed on the PackSafe Chart

constraints.examples: Anything that includes powders, chemicals, liquids, gases, or aerosols
constraints.carry_on_details: The first step would be to get a Safety Data Sheet (SDS) for each product. In the SDS, section 14, you can find the transportation information (ie. if the product is a regulated dangerous good). On passenger aircraft regulated dangerous goods are not allowed by passengers. ...if it is a regulated product, it would not be allowed in either checked or carry-on baggage. [cite_start]If they are not regulated, then they would be allowed. [cite: 12]
constraints.checked_details: The first step would be to get a Safety Data Sheet (SDS) for each product. In the SDS, section 14, you can find the transportation information (i.e. if the product is a regulated dangerous good). On passenger aircraft regulated dangerous goods are not allowed by passengers. ...if it is a regulated product, it would not be allowed in either checked or carry-on baggage. [cite_start]If they are not regulated, then they would be allowed. [cite: 12]

constraints.examples: Hairspray, hand sanitizers, aerosols, rubbing alcohol, inhalers, nail polish and remover, etc.
constraints.carry_on_details: If it does not touch your body when you use it, then it likely does not qualify for the medicinal & toiletry article exception. Not all carry-on items may be used during flight. Consult the flight crew before using items that give off strong odors or vapors such as nail polish and remover. [cite_start]Liquids, gels, and aerosols in carry-on baggage are further limited to 100-ml (3.4 oz) containers at the TSA security checkpoint. [cite: 17]
constraints.checked_details: Quantity limits: The total aggregate quantity per person cannot exceed 2 kg (70 ounces) or 2 L (68 fluid ounces). [cite_start]The capacity of each container must not exceed 0.5 kg (18 ounces) or 500 ml (17 fluid ounces). [cite: 17]

constraints.examples: Cell phones, cell phone battery charging cases, laptops, cameras, smart phones, electronics, data loggers, PDAs containing lithium batteries, games, tablets, watches, etc.
constraints.carry_on_details: Devices containing lithium metal or lithium ion batteries (laptops, smartphones, tablets, etc.) should be carried in carry-on baggage. Flight crews are trained to recognize and respond to lithium battery fires in the cabin. [cite_start]Passengers should notify flight crew immediately if their lithium battery or device is overheating, expanding, smoking or burning. [cite: 17]
constraints.checked_details: When portable electronic devices powered by lithium batteries are in checked baggage, they must be completely powered off and protected to prevent unintentional activation or damage. [cite_start]Electronic devices capable of generating extreme heat, which could cause a fire if activated, heating elements must be isolated by removal of the heating element, battery or other components. [cite: 17]

constraints.examples: Rubber cement, pipe cement, some super glues and other flammable adhesives
constraints.carry_on_details: [cite_start]Most model glues, rubber cements, and industrial-strength adhesives are flammable and not allowed in carry-on or checked baggage. [cite: 17]
constraints.checked_details: [cite_start]Most model glues, rubber cements, and industrial-strength adhesives are flammable and not allowed in carry-on or checked baggage. [cite: 17]

constraints.examples: School glue, glue sticks, etc.
constraints.carry_on_details: [cite_start]Nonflammable, non-toxic adhesive/glue is not restricted as a hazardous material. [cite: 17]
constraints.checked_details: [cite_start]Nonflammable, non-toxic adhesive/glue is not restricted as a hazardous material. [cite: 17]

constraints.examples: Non-toiletry, WD-40, spray paint, spray starch, cooking spray, etc.
constraints.carry_on_details: [cite_start]Flammable aerosols that don't qualify as a medicinal or toiletry article are forbidden in carry-on and checked baggage. [cite: 17]
constraints.checked_details: [cite_start]Flammable aerosols that don't qualify as a medicinal or toiletry article are forbidden in carry-on and checked baggage. [cite: 17]

constraints.examples: Nonflammable aerosols (with no other hazard), non-toiletry, some electronics cleaners, whipped cream
constraints.carry_on_details: Nonflammable aerosols (hazard class 2.2 with no other hazard subrisks) that do not qualify for the medicinal/toiletry article exception may be carried in carry-on and checked baggage. Aerosol release devices (button/nozzle) must be protected with a cap or other means to protect against accidental release. [cite_start]The release of gas must also not cause extreme annoyance or discomfort to crew members... [cite: 17]
constraints.checked_details: Nonflammable aerosols (hazard class 2.2 with no other hazard subrisks) that do not qualify for the medicinal/toiletry article exception may be carried in carry-on and checked baggage. Aerosol release devices (button/nozzle) must be protected with a cap or other means to protect against accidental release. [cite_start]The release of gas must also not cause extreme annoyance or discomfort to crew members... [cite: 17]

constraints.examples: To include Scuba and SCBA
constraints.carry_on_details: [cite_start]Not allowed in Carry On or Checked Bags if pressurized [cite: 17]
constraints.checked_details: [cite_start]Not allowed in Carry On or Checked Bags if pressurized [cite: 17]

constraints.examples: In unopened retail packaging, containing more than 24% but not more than 70% alcohol by volume (up to 140 proof)
constraints.carry_on_details: Must be in unopened retail packagings. [cite_start]Liquids, gels, and aerosols in carry-on baggage are further limited to 100-ml (3.4 oz) containers at the TSA security checkpoint. [cite: 20]
constraints.checked_details: Must be in unopened retail packagings. [cite_start]Quantity limits: 5 L (1.3 gallons) per packaging and 5 L total per passenger. [cite: 20]

constraints.examples: Greater than 70% alcohol by volume (more than 140 proof), including grain alcohol and 151 proof rum
constraints.carry_on_details: [cite_start]Not allowed in Carry On or Checked Bags [cite: 20]
constraints.checked_details: [cite_start]Not allowed in Carry On or Checked Bags [cite: 20]

constraints.examples: Cartridges up to 19.1mm, shotgun shells
constraints.carry_on_details: [cite_start]Not allowed in Carry On Bags [cite: 20]
constraints.checked_details: Ammunition must be securely packed in boxes or other devices specifically designed to carry small amounts of ammunition. Ammunition clips and magazines must also be securely boxed so no ammunition is loose or exposed. [cite_start]Loaded firearms are forbidden. [cite: 20]

constraints.examples: Bear spray, animal repellent
constraints.carry_on_details: [cite_start]Not allowed in Carry On or Checked Bags [cite: 20]
constraints.checked_details: [cite_start]Not allowed in Carry On or Checked Bags [cite: 20]

constraints.examples: Models that contain a small explosive charge (squib) to release the cylinder contents
constraints.carry_on_details: Not allowed in Carry On or Checked Bags. [cite_start]For models that only contain compressed air... see the entry for Self-Inflating Personal Safety Devices... For models that contain Li-batteries, see PackSafe battery guidance... [cite: 20]
constraints.checked_details: Not allowed in Carry On or Checked Bags. [cite_start]For models that only contain compressed air... see the entry for Self-Inflating Personal Safety Devices... For models that contain Li-batteries, see PackSafe battery guidance... [cite: 20]

constraints.examples: This covers typical non-lithium dry batteries (alkaline, nickel metal hydride, nickel cadmiumetc., ) in the most common sizes: AA, AAA, C, D, button cell, 9-volt, etc.
constraints.carry_on_details: [cite_start]Battery terminals (usually the ends) must be protected from short circuit... Methods include: leaving the batteries in their retail packaging, covering battery terminals with non-metallic tape, using a battery case... or putting them snugly in a plastic bag or protective pouch. [cite: 20]
constraints.checked_details: [cite_start]Battery terminals (usually the ends) must be protected from short circuit... Methods include: leaving the batteries in their retail packaging, covering battery terminals with non-metallic tape, using a battery case... or putting them snugly in a plastic bag or protective pouch. [cite: 20]

constraints.examples: Small gel cell and absorbed electrolyte batteries for portable electronics
constraints.carry_on_details: This entry is for nonspillable batteries with absorbed electrolyte... used in portable electronic devices. It does not cover large vehicle batteries. ...Spare/uninstalled batteries must be in strong packaging. [cite_start]Battery and outer packaging must be marked ""nonspillable"" or ""nonspillable battery."" [cite: 20]
constraints.checked_details: This entry is for nonspillable batteries with absorbed electrolyte... used in portable electronic devices. It does not cover large vehicle batteries. ...Spare/uninstalled batteries must be in strong packaging. [cite_start]Battery and outer packaging must be marked ""nonspillable"" or ""nonspillable battery. [cite: 20]

constraints.examples: Diving lamps, soldering equipment
constraints.carry_on_details: [cite_start]These are allowed in checked and carry-on baggage, with airline approval, when a component (battery, fuse, heat element) is isolated to prevent unintentional activation... If the battery has been completely removed then the device is not restricted... [cite: 25]
constraints.checked_details: [cite_start]These are allowed in checked and carry-on baggage, with airline approval, when a component (battery, fuse, heat element) is isolated to prevent unintentional activation... If the battery has been completely removed then the device is not restricted... [cite: 25]

rules.item_name: Camping Stoves and Fuel Bottles Completely Purged of Fuel

constraints.examples: Camping stoves and equipment that contains no residual fuel
constraints.carry_on_details: Camping stoves and equipment that contain no residual fuel, vapors, or other hazardous materials are allowed. [cite_start]Some airlines may not accept used camping equipment... Check your airline's policy. [cite: 25]
constraints.checked_details: Camping stoves and equipment that contain no residual fuel, vapors, or other hazardous materials are allowed. [cite_start]Some airlines may not accept used camping equipment... Check your airline's policy. [cite: 25]

constraints.examples: Water test kits, soil test kits, children's chemistry sets, etc. when containing hazardous materials
constraints.carry_on_details: The safety data sheets (SDS) of each individual chemical in the kit must be examined to know if it is a hazardous material. [cite_start]Section 14 of the SDS should identify if a chemical/substance is a regulated hazardous materials... [cite: 25]
constraints.checked_details: [cite_start]The safety data sheets (SDS) of each individual chemical in the kit must be examined to know if it is a hazardous material, Section 14 of the SDS should identify if a chemical/substance is a regulated hazardous materials... [cite: 25]

constraints.examples: Cordless curling iron containing a gas cartridge, butane fueled curling irons
constraints.carry_on_details: A safety cover must be securely fitted over the heating element. The device must be protected from accidental activation. Gas refills (spare cartridges) are not permitted. [cite_start]Electric curling irons... (cord plugs into an electric outlet) are not restricted. [cite: 25]
constraints.checked_details: [cite_start]Not allowed in Checked Bags [cite: 25]

constraints.examples: Primary and spare batteries, fuel cells, components of certain parachute systems
constraints.carry_on_details: Your drone might be a dangerous good! Lithium batteries, fuel cells, and components of certain parachute. systems can all be classified as dangerous goods. [cite_start]If you have any questions, please consult your operating manual or contact the manufacturer and airline prior to traveling. [cite: 25]
constraints.checked_details: Your drone might be a dangerous good! Lithium batteries, fuel cells, and components of certain parachute systems can all be classified as dangerous goods. [cite_start]If you have any questions, please consult your operating manual or contact the manufacturer and airline prior to traveling. [cite: 25]

constraints.examples: Carbon dioxide, solid, 2.5 kg (5.5 lbs) or less, when used to pack perishables
constraints.carry_on_details: Airline approval is required. [cite_start]Packages must NOT be air tight and must allow the release of carbon dioxide gas. [cite: 25]
constraints.checked_details: Airline approval is required. Packages must NOT be air tight and must allow the release of carbon dioxide gas. [cite_start]When in checked baggage, the package must be marked ""Dry ice"" or ""Carbon dioxide, solid"" and marked with the net quantity of dry ice, or an indication that it is 2.5 kg (5.5 lbs) or less. [cite: 25]

constraints.examples: Perfumes and colognes purchased through airport and airline duty free shops
constraints.carry_on_details: Because these are typically purchased at the airport or even on the aircraft, the quantity restrictions for toiletry articles do not apply here when purchased through Duty Free and carried on your person or in carry on baggage. [cite_start]However, quantities are generally regulated by customs/duty rules. [cite: 25]
constraints.checked_details: [cite_start]For perfumes and cologne in checked baggage or not purchased through dutyfree -sales, see the entry for Medicinal and Toiletry Articles. [cite: 25]

rules.item_name: Engine Powered Equipment Completely Purged of Fuel

constraints.examples: Chainsaws, generators, trimmers, etc.
constraints.carry_on_details: [cite_start]This entry is for engines that have been completely purged of all liquid or gaseous fuel, including residue and vapors. [cite: 30]
constraints.checked_details: [cite_start]Even if completely purged, some airlines may refuse to allow engine powered equipment in baggage if it has ever contained fuel. [cite: 30]

rules.item_name: Engine Powered Equipment with Residual Fuel

constraints.examples: Chainsaws, generators, trimmers, etc.
constraints.carry_on_details: [cite_start]Not allowed in Carry On or Checked Bags [cite: 30]
constraints.checked_details: [cite_start]Not allowed in Carry On or Checked Bags [cite: 30]

constraints.examples: Firecrackers, bottle rockets, poppers, sparklers, M-80s, fire crackers, Roman candles
constraints.carry_on_details: [cite_start]All fireworks, no matter how small, are forbidden in carry-on and checked baggage. [cite: 30]
constraints.checked_details: [cite_start]All fireworks, no matter how small, are forbidden in carry-on and checked baggage. [cite: 30]

constraints.examples: Including containers and equipment with residual fuel
constraints.carry_on_details: [cite_start]Not allowed in Carry On or Checked Bags [cite: 30]
constraints.checked_details: [cite_start]Not allowed in Carry On or Checked Bags [cite: 30]

constraints.carry_on_details: Formaldehyde solutions of less than 10% are not restricted as hazardous materials. [cite_start]Leakproof packaging with absorbent material is still strongly encouraged. [cite: 30]
constraints.checked_details: Formaldehyde solutions of less than 10% are not restricted as hazardous materials. [cite_start]Leakproof packaging with absorbent material is still strongly encouraged. [cite: 30]

rules.item_name: Fuel Cells Containing Flammable Gases or Water-Reactive Material

constraints.carry_on_details: Each fuel cell must also be marked ""Approved for carriage in aircraft cabin only"". [cite_start]Each fuel cell cartridge (not the electronic device) must be marked with the maximum quantity and type of fuel in the cartridge. [cite: 30]
constraints.checked_details: [cite_start]Not allowed in Checked Bags [cite: 30]

rules.item_name: Fuel Cells Containing Flammable Liquid or Corrosive Material

constraints.carry_on_details: Each fuel cell must also be marked ""Approved for carriage in aircraft cabin only"". [cite_start]Each fuel cell cartridge (not the electronic device) must be marked with the maximum quantity and type of fuel in the cartridge. [cite: 30]
constraints.checked_details: Each fuel cell must also be marked ""Approved for carriage in aircraft cabin only"". [cite_start]Each fuel cell cartridge (not the electronic device) must be marked with the maximum quantity and type of fuel in the cartridge. [cite: 30]

rules.item_name: Hand Warmers, Toe Warmers, Body Warmers

constraints.examples: Disposable warming pads using carbon, charcoal, and iron compounds, Hot Hands, Little Hotties, etc.
constraints.carry_on_details: [cite_start]These air-activated body-warming pads are not regulated as hazardous materials for transportation and may be carried in carry-on or checked baggage. [cite: 30]
constraints.checked_details: [cite_start]These air-activated body-warming pads are not regulated as hazardous materials for transportation and may be carried in carry-on or checked baggage. [cite: 30]

constraints.examples: Instant/rapid ice packs that are activated by force-when used for medical/first aid purposes.
constraints.carry_on_details: [cite_start]These items are allowed in carry-on or checked baggage when carried for medical purposes such as the treatment of sporting injuries. [cite: 30]
constraints.checked_details: [cite_start]These items are allowed in carry-on or checked baggage when carried for medical purposes such as the treatment of sporting injuries. [cite: 30]

constraints.examples: Unabsorbed liquid (desk/table lighters, antique wick lighters), absorbed liquids, butane (Zippo-type lighters, disposable lighters)
constraints.carry_on_details: Absorbed liquid and butane lighters are limited to one lighter per passenger in carry-on or on one's person. [cite_start]When a carry-on bag is checked at the gate or at planeside, any lighter in the carry-on must be removed from the bag and kept with the passenger in the aircraft cabin. [cite: 35]
constraints.checked_details: [cite_start]Not allowed in Checked Bags [cite: 35]

rules.item_name: Liquid Nitrogen in a Dry Shipper

constraints.carry_on_details: A dry shipper is an insulated cryogenic flask/container that contains refrigerated liquid nitrogen absorbed into a porous lining. [cite_start]It is used to transport specimens. [cite: 35]
constraints.checked_details: A dry shipper is an insulated cryogenic flask/container that contains refrigerated liquid nitrogen absorbed into a porous lining. [cite_start]It is used to transport specimens. [cite: 35]

constraints.examples: Tesla coil lighters, flux lighters, arc lighters, double arc lighters
constraints.carry_on_details: [cite_start]Each lithium ion battery must not exceed a watt hour (Wh) rating of 100 Wh; or for lithium metal batteries, a lithium content of 2 grams. [cite: 35]
constraints.checked_details: [cite_start]Not allowed in Checked Bags [cite: 35]

constraints.examples: Items which create a magnetic field, fishing magnets
constraints.carry_on_details: [cite_start]A magnetic field of more than 0.00525 gauss measured at 4.5 m (15 feet) from any surface of the package or magnet cannot fly. [cite: 35]
constraints.checked_details: [cite_start]A magnetic field of more than 0.00525 gauss measured at 4.5 m (15 feet) from any surface of the package or magnet cannot fly. [cite: 35]

constraints.examples: Safety matches, waterproof matches
constraints.carry_on_details: One book/packet of matches in carry-on or on the person. [cite_start]When a carry-on bag is checked at the gate or at planeside, any matches in the carry-on must be removed from the bag and kept with the passenger in the aircraft cabin. [cite: 35]
constraints.checked_details: [cite_start]Not allowed in Checked Bags [cite: 35]

constraints.carry_on_details: [cite_start]Strike-anywhere matches are forbidden in carry-on and checked baggage. [cite: 35]
constraints.checked_details: [cite_start]Strike-anywhere matches are forbidden in carry-on and checked baggage. [cite: 35]

constraints.examples: Heart pacemakers that contain radioactive materials or lithium batteries and radiopharmaceuticals that have been ingested, injected, or implanted.
constraints.carry_on_details: [cite_start]For medical devices containing lithium batteries that are implanted or externally fitted, or carried by passengers and crew, the quantity limits for Portable Electronic Devices, Containing Batteries apply. [cite: 35]
constraints.checked_details: [cite_start]Not allowed in Checked Bags [cite: 35]

constraints.examples: Small medical thermometer
constraints.carry_on_details: [cite_start]Not allowed in Carry On Bags [cite: 35]
constraints.checked_details: [cite_start]One small medical or clinical mercury thermometer for personal use, when carried in a protective case in checked baggage. [cite: 35]

constraints.examples: Carried by government weather bureau or similar official agency.
constraints.carry_on_details: [cite_start]Must be in carry-on baggage only. [cite: 35]
constraints.checked_details: [cite_start]Not allowed in Checked Bags [cite: 35]

constraints.carry_on_details: Included in, not in addition to, the quantity limits for other medicinal and toiletry articles... The total aggregate quantity per person cannot exceed 2 kg (70 ounces) or 2 L (68 fluid ounces). The capacity of each container must not exceed 0.5 kg (18 ounces) or 500 ml (17 fluid ounces). [cite_start]Aerosols in carry-on baggage are further limited to 100-ml (3.4 oz) containers at the TSA security checkpoint. [cite: 40]
constraints.checked_details: Included in, not in addition to, the quantity limits for other medicinal and toiletry articles: The total aggregate quantity per person cannot exceed 2 kg (70 ounces) or 2 L (68 fluid ounces). [cite_start]The capacity of each container must not exceed 0.5 kg (18 ounces) or 500 ml (17 fluid ounces). [cite: 40]

constraints.examples: Containing formaldehyde, ethanol, isopropanol, or other alcohols
constraints.carry_on_details: No more than 30 ml of free liquid solution in each inner packaging and no more than one liter in the entire outer package. [cite_start]The outer package is suitable marked ""Scientific research specimens, 49 CFR 173.4b applies"". [cite: 40]
constraints.checked_details: No more than 30 ml of free liquid solution in each inner packaging and no more than one liter in the entire outer package. [cite_start]The outer package is suitable marked ""Scientific research specimens, 49 CFR 173.4b applies. [cite: 40]

constraints.examples: Motor oil, engine oil, 3-in-1 oil, baby oil, mineral oil, body oil, olive oil, most cooking oils
constraints.carry_on_details: [cite_start]Liquids in carry-on baggage are further limited to 100-ml (3.4 oz) containers at the TSA security checkpoint. [cite: 40]
constraints.checked_details: [cite_start]Not regulated in liquid form. [cite: 40]

constraints.examples: Medical oxygen, recreational oxygen
constraints.carry_on_details: Passengers may not carry their own oxygen (compressed oxygen or liquid oxygen) in carry-on baggage, in checked baggage or on their person. [cite_start]Products such as ""canned oxygen,"" ""recreational oxygen"" and ""flavored oxygen"" are also prohibited. [cite: 40]
constraints.checked_details: Passengers may not carry their own oxygen (compressed oxygen or liquid oxygen) in carry-on baggage, in checked baggage or on their person. [cite_start]Products such as ""canned oxygen,"" ""recreational oxygen"" and ""flavored oxygen"" are also prohibited. [cite: 40]

constraints.examples: Thinners, turpentine, MEK, denatured alcohol, acetone, resins, lacquers, varnishes, stains
constraints.carry_on_details: [cite_start]Most paints and paint-related solvents are regulated as flammable liquids and are forbidden in carry-on or checked baggage. [cite: 40]
constraints.checked_details: [cite_start]Most paints and paint-related solvents are regulated as flammable liquids and are forbidden in carry-on or checked baggage. [cite: 40]

constraints.examples: Watercolors, acrylics, pigments and most artist oil paints
constraints.carry_on_details: [cite_start]Artist paints that are nonflammable are not regulated by FAA and may be carried in carry-on"" or checked baggage. [cite: 40]
constraints.checked_details: [cite_start]Artist paints that are nonflammable are not regulated by FAA and may be carried in carry-on or checked baggage. [cite: 40]

rules.item_name: Permeation Devices for Calibrating Air Quality Monitoring Equipment

constraints.carry_on_details: [cite_start]Not allowed in Carry On Bags [cite: 40]
constraints.checked_details: The total quantity of hazardous materials in the device is limited to 2 ml (0.07 ounces). The device and its packaging cannot weigh more than 30 kg (66 pounds). [cite_start]The device must be constructed and packaged in accordance with the requirements found in 49 CFR 173.175 [cite: 40]

constraints.examples: Inogen One, Sequal Eclipse, Airsep Lifestyle and others approved by FAA
constraints.carry_on_details: [cite_start]Portable oxygen concentrators (POCs) do not actually contain or generate oxygen, they concentrate it from the ambient air. [cite: 40]
constraints.checked_details: [cite_start]Portable oxygen concentrators (POCs) do not actually contain or generate oxygen, they concentrate it from the ambient air. [cite: 40]

rules.item_name: Portable Recreational Vehicles Powered by Lithium Ion Batteries

constraints.examples: Hover boards, self-balancing scooters, unicycle scooters, etc.
constraints.carry_on_details: Under U.S. and international regulations, these devices may be carried like other portable electronic devices... Airline approval is required for any lithium ion battery exceeding 100 watt hours (Wh). [cite_start]The airline may choose to not accept the devices at all... A device with a lithium ion battery that exceeds 160 watt hours (Wh) is prohibited... [cite: 45]
constraints.checked_details: Under U.S. and international regulations, these devices may be carried like other portable electronic devices... Airline approval is required for any lithium ion battery exceeding 100 watt hours (Wh). [cite_start]The airline may choose to not accept the devices at all... A device with a lithium ion battery that exceeds 160 watt hours (Wh) is prohibited... [cite: 45]

constraints.examples: Mace, pepper spray not exceeding 118 ml (4 fluid ounces)
constraints.carry_on_details: [cite_start]Not allowed in Carry On Bags [cite: 45]
constraints.checked_details: [cite_start]One self defense spray, not exceeding 118 ml (4 fluid ounces), per passenger in checked baggage only. [cite: 45]

rules.item_name: Self-Inflating Personal Safety Devices (intended to be worn by a person)

constraints.examples: Inflatable life jackets, safety vests, motorcycle vests, riding vests
constraints.carry_on_details: [cite_start]No more than two self-inflating personal safety devices, fitted with no more than two small gas cartridges per device (containing no hazardous material other than a Division 2.2 gas) for inflation purposes plus no more than two spare cartridges per device. [cite: 45]
constraints.checked_details: [cite_start]No more than two self-inflating personal safety devices, fitted with no more than two small gas cartridges per device (containing no hazardous material other than a Division 2.2 gas) for inflation purposes plus no more than two spare cartridges per device. [cite: 45]

constraints.carry_on_details: [cite_start]Flares and other similar flammable/explosive products are forbidden in carry-on and checked baggage. [cite: 45]
constraints.checked_details: [cite_start]Flares and other similar flammable/explosive products are forbidden in carry-on and checked baggage. [cite: 45]

rules.item_name: Small Compressed Gas Cylinders and Cartridges in or with a Device

constraints.examples: Carbon dioxide (CO2) and other nonflammable, nontoxic gases
constraints.carry_on_details: [cite_start]Not allowed in Carry On Bags [cite: 45]
constraints.checked_details: Up to four cartridges/cylinders containing nonflammable gas may be carried. Each cylinder must not exceed 50 ml (equivalent to 28 g carbon dioxide cartridge). Cartridges/cylinders not installed in the device should be securely packed. [cite_start]Compressed gas cylinders... larger than 50 ml are forbidden in baggage unless covered by another exception... [cite: 45]

rules.item_name: Small Compressed Gas Cylinders for Mechanical Limbs

constraints.carry_on_details: Cylinders/cartridges containing nonflammable, nontoxic gases may be worn in mechanical limbs and spare cylinders/cartridges may be carried in carry-on or checked baggage. [cite_start]A sufficient number of cylinders/cartridges to ensure an adequate supply for the duration of the journey is authorized. [cite: 45]
constraints.checked_details: Cylinders/cartridges containing nonflammable, nontoxic gases may be worn in mechanical limbs and spare cylinders/cartridges may be carried in carry-on or checked baggage. [cite_start]A sufficient number of cylinders/cartridges to ensure an adequate supply for the duration of the journey is authorized. [cite: 45]

constraints.examples: Butane lighters, blue flame lighters, jet flame lighters
constraints.carry_on_details: [cite_start]Not allowed in Carry On or Checked Bags [cite: 45]
constraints.checked_details: [cite_start]Not allowed in Carry On or Checked Bags [cite: 45]

rules.item_name: Wheelchairs and Mobility Aids with Lithium Ion Batteries that are Not Adequately Protected and Batteries Removed

constraints.examples: Electric wheelchair, mobility scooter
constraints.carry_on_details: ...in these cases the batteries must be removed. Lithium ion battery size is limited to 300 watt hours (Wh). One spare battery not exceeding 300 Wh or two spare batteries not exceeding 160 Wh each may be carried in carry-on baggage. [cite_start]Lithium metal (non-rechargeable lithium) batteries are forbidden... [cite: 48]
constraints.checked_details: [cite_start]Not allowed in Checked Bags [cite: 48]

rules.item_name: Wheelchairs and Mobility Aids with Lithium Ion Batteries, with Batteries Installed and Protected

constraints.examples: Electric wheelchair, mobility scooter
constraints.carry_on_details: [cite_start]Not allowed in Carry On Bags [cite: 48]
constraints.checked_details: The battery may remain installed only if it is securely attached to the mobility device, the battery housing provides protection from damage, and the terminals are protected from short circuit. A maximum of one spare battery not exceeding 300 Wh or two spare batteries not exceeding 160 Wh each may be carried. Spare batteries must be carried in the cabin. [cite_start]Lithium metal (non-rechargeable lithium) batteries are forbidden... [cite: 48]

rules.item_name: Wheelchairs and Mobility Devices with Non-Spillable or Dry Batteries

constraints.examples: Electric wheelchair, mobility scooter
constraints.carry_on_details: [cite_start]Not allowed in Carry On Bags [cite: 48]
constraints.checked_details: The battery may remain installed if it is securely attached to the mobility device, the battery housing provides protection from damage, and the terminals are protected from short circuit. The battery cables may remain connected only if the device is protected from accidental activation. For complete passenger instructions contact your airline. [cite_start]Advance arrangements and extra check-in time may be necessary. [cite: 48]

rules.item_name: Wheelchairs and Mobility Devices with Spillable Batteries

constraints.examples: Electric wheelchair, mobility scooter
constraints.carry_on_details: [cite_start]Not allowed in Carry On Bags [cite: 48]
constraints.checked_details: The battery may remain installed if it is securely attached... and the battery remains in an upright position when stowed on the aircraft. For complete passenger instructions contact your airline. Advance arrangements and extra check-in time may be necessary. [cite_start]The airline may need to remove the battery and package it separately if the wheelchair cannot be stowed upright in the cargo compartment. [cite: 48]
